title: What is the worst K-pop album cover ever? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hmm…There are a few that come to mind. Granted, there are many embarrassing covers that could simply be understood as being “of that era” and excusable on those grounds (such as several from the mid-1990s on to the early 2000s that went overboard with intentionally overexposed images…and everyone’s noses disappeared!). Just the same here are the ones that stand out in my memory. Excuse me for adding a few pre-1992 creations to the list. The biggest boyband hit of the late 1980s, with fashion from the “Pierrot-meets-military-rule” school of haute couture : 소방차 2집 (1988) . Yes, even superstars can bring the cringe: 이승철 2집 (1990) . Not that bad, eh? That is until you see how the liner jacket (if you ever find a copy) had a lazy and hastily rehashed cover image…with his head chopped off and placed in an upper corner, body in the lower corner. 심신1집 (1991) . To be sure, the second LP release by 신승훈 stands as a legendary pre-1992 release, ballads like 보이지 않은 사랑 and all. But shooting an album cover with the man’s face sharply illuminated by the sun, featuring the cafe chain’s name on the window, and calling the album a rather confusing “Vol.2” (as if it were a compilation) had so much wrong with it: 신승훈 2집 (1991) . Great. Noise was of the most popular boy groups of the early to mid 1990s (all under 김창환's insanely successful Line Productions label), and you award them by omitting the handsome fellows and instead putting a silly animal comic graphic on the cover of their third release?: Noise/ 3rd Revolution (1995) . It admittedly doesn’t feel right for me to post this one, since 박미경 is such a wonderful soul and I have had nothing but very pleasant interactions with her over the past 20+ years. However, Line Productions really messed things up with the cover of her most popular release and I have to include it in this list. Just read everything as printed the cover out loud to hear how wrong it all is: 박미경 2집 (1995) . Psychedelic eyesore from summertime’s forever best sellers: 쿨3집 (1996) . What’s wrong with this picture? BASIS was always a trio, but the two female members who both sang and played violin on the first two BASIS recordings (sisters 김아연, 김연빈) left after the 2nd album. And so, the lone core member 정재형 put out this 3rd BASIS release with a mildly awkward framing of the cover. The title of the album is what makes the cover of the album all the weirder, considering that he’s now a solo act: 베이시스 3집 FRIENDS (1997) . A chopped off face on top of your head is never a good idea, and oddly placed color points on a black and white layout can be remarkably distracting, no matter how intentionally done: Position 3집 (1998) . Funky layout and bad text placement: Baby Vox #3 (1999) . Ew…why? The early 2000s was a weird time for everyone after the IMF era, namely for there being less money floating around to produce and promote. Admittedly, Turtles were the best hybrid trot-dance team made for the masses, and were mad catchy on the first two albums. But c’mon (RIP Turtle Man) : 거부기 2집 (2003) . The visual J-rock concept taken to the local extreme (and Eve being rather successful at that). But putting your record company’s URL on the cover?: 이브2집 (2001) . One of the last successful guy/gal quartets, albeit with covers like this: 샵 3집 (2000)  . In the post-LP market, the freedom to leave the square-shaped release brought about a good amount of creativity with layout. Unfortunately, some look really weird both from a distance as well as up close. Mind you, there was an alternate for this one used as well, sans invisible name and apparent Pinocchio nose: 박화요비 6집 (2008)

Dreamcatcher’s Japanese comeback breaking out  It’s boring. I always think it’s uncreative and boring when kpop idols just are plastered on the cover of their album. I know what they look like and unless the picture is really cool and artsy it looks kind of lazy.The colours are ugly and honestly don’t fit the concept of the song. Why’re there random splashes of yellow and green light?They don’t look lik dreamcatcher. I can’t put my finger on what it is, but something about their faces looks kind of distorted? They’re so much prettier irl, I don’t know what happened to this album cover
